you may make and construct this pattern and sell what you make from this pattern but you may not sell or give away the pattern itself page 1 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com broomhilda the witch pattern pattern difficulty medium i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together supplies size g hook worsted weight yarn red heart super saver works nicely  black  orange  lt brown  green for the skin all i had on hand was lime green and it worked pretty well gauge is unimportant for this project terms single_crochet = single_crochet increase = increase two single_crochet in same stitch decrease = decrease crochet two stitches together blo = back loops only flo = front loops only half_double_crochet = half-double_crochet st = stitch note broomhilda is worked in the round when i crochet in the round i join rounds and i single_crochet in the same space as joining so i m assuming that at the end of each round you are slip stitching to the first stitch of that round and that you chain 1 to start the next round you can work in spirals if that s easier for you just remember to mark your rounds you want your stitches tight and close together so the stuffing doesn t show through later on to start each piece you can chain 2 and work your 6 stitches into the 2nd stitch from the hook or you can use the magic_ring be creative and have fun page 2 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com the hair these are the instructions to make the hair curly if you want curly hair do this part first before you make any other parts if you don t want curly hair you can skip this part and just cut 6 inch lengths of yarn later on to make the hair straight 1 you need to crochet or knit a swatch of your hair colored yarn approximately 25 stitches wide and 12 row high i used a g hook my doll has 3 row of hair under her hat make your swatch bigger if you want more hair single_crochet will make tighter curls than double_crochet knitting makes a nice curled yarn too 2 when finished with step one wet the square thoroughly wrap it in a towel and squeeze it dry set it aside for a few days and let it dry and set completely 3 when you are done with all the other parts of the doll and are ready to put on the hair unravel the swatch you had made without stretching it too much wrap it around something
